To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFro=
m: debbie@...: Wed, 2 Jan 2008 13:00:37 -0700Subject: [EVP=
-ITC] RS 470



Thanks all for the info on the 470. I did call the RS 800 n=
umber and the person I spoke with could not guarantee that the radio pictur=
ed on their web site would be the one that ships (it's a photo of the old m=
odel). Confusing -- he said that he's in Louisville and the warehouse is in=
 Kentucky and so he couldn't physically check himself or contact someone in=
 the warehouse. The last time I looked at a map, I could have sworn Louisvi=
lle was in Kentucky. 

If anyone comes across the old 470 in your travels, =
please keep me in mind. I'll continue to look myself.

Any suggestions for =
another good hack? I did hear the clicking on the 469(?) and it is too much=
.









_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

Deb T

'Once you can accept the universe as mat=
ter expanding into nothing that is something, wearing stripes with plaid co=
mes easy. '  ~Albert Einstein

On Jan 2, 2008, at 10:46 AM, bruce halliday =
wrote:





Deb, The old model of the 470 is now like hens teeth I doubt ve=
ry much if you will be able to find oneIf I come across one I will let you =
know. You may want to ask at your local radio shack if they would call othe=
r stores and see if any of them have any in stockI did that and wound up wi=
th 8 that promptly got snatched up by new researchers. If you can not get t=
he older 470 maybe you can find the old model 469 which looks exactly like =
the old 470 but the differencebetween the old and new model 469 is that the=
 older model does not have that annoying clicking. It scans smoothly. I am =
attaching a pic of the old model 470 make sure you tell the person at RS yo=
u want the one in the box not the see throughpackage. If you want to check =
out my box site it's http://free-paranormalinvestigating.com/franksboxjoesb=
ox/ Bruce
Bruce Halliday 


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: debbie@tejadad=
esign.comDate: Wed, 2 Jan 2008 10:12:08 -0700Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: New=
 files in my Radio Shack Box Folder


Steve (or anyone else who knows about=
 this), 


The new 470 is all black and can't be modified as of yet 

Based=
 on your comments about the 12-469, I'm going to pick up a 12-470 later tod=
ay. I called our local Radio Shack and the guy insisted that the new 12-470=
 is exactly the same as the old one, just the case is a different color (gr=
ey & black). I specifically asked if the electronics were set up the same w=
ay and he said yes, they're exactly the same. Do you suppose he's right abo=
ut that? Or just doesn't know the product that well?









_ _ _ _ _ _ _=
 _

Debbie Tejada


'Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding i=
nto nothing that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy. '  ~A=
lbert Einstein

On Jan 1, 2008, at 8:44 PM, Steve Hultay wrote:




There i=
s no pulsing on the older style 12-470, just clear communication. My 12-469=
 is sitting in the corner and i'll probably never touch it again because th=
at constant pulse noise is very distracting to get past to hear any audible=
 messages. That's just my personal opinion anyway for what it's worth. If y=
ou listen to my radio shack files from today you will hear the difference b=
etween the two boxes. The sweep between the two are both linear, but one ha=
s the pulse sound and one is just a clean sweep without the pulse. Ask your=
 local radio shack if they have any 12-470 older style models, they are gra=
y with a white top and also has a built in speaker. The new 470 is all blac=
k and can't be modified as of yet but i think Mike C. could figure it out i=
f he didn't have 500 other projects going at the same time....lol Any quest=
ions just shoot me an e-mail and i will help the best i can.-Steve H.--- In=
 EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, 'babiarz3' <babiarz3@...> wrote:>> > Steve, hope =
your holidays were wonderful. We haven't had the chance to> speak in a few =
weeks.> What are the difference in the 469 and the 470 besides 2 channel vs=
.> 4? You are still choosing one channel and it is still a linear sweep> ri=
ght? Technically, what would be the difference in choosing AM on the> 469 a=
nd AM on the 470? The pulsing sound is absolutely annoying. > > Babs > > > =
--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, 'Steve Hultay' <urkel23@> wrote:> >> > > > =
Had a pretty good session today, i've been pretty blocked with other > > bo=
xes yet i seem to always get great results with the RS 12-470. Some > > rea=
lly good responses to my questions. Hey babs, i think you should > > give t=
he RS box a little time and maybe you will start to get stuff. > > Although=
 i have a 12-469 also and it really sux compared to the 12-> > 470. The con=
stant pulsing noise in the 469 model just drives me crazy > > enough to not=
 concentrate. Try looking for an older style model of the > > 12-470, that'=
s probably the best radio i own hands down. Instant > > results always and =
consistently. All my boxes work, but they are > > finicky sometimes. No nee=
d to comment to my posted files guys, just > > listen and see if i'm on som=
e sort of a right track with the > > communication.> > > > -Steve H.> >>

on't get caught with egg on your face. Play Chicktionary! Check it out!
